com.valentine.esp

Class ValentineESP

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.valentine.esp.ValentineESP

  • public class ValentineESP
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the underlying class that connects to and processes packets from the Valentine One. This is wrapped by the ValentineClient class to extract out the data from the packets so the programmer does not not need to handle packets in any fashion. Nothing here should be called directly, but instead through the ValentineClient class.

      Class to hold the callback data.

      • isInDemoMode

        public boolean isInDemoMode()
        This method will allow the caller to determine if the ESP library is operating in demo mode or not.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the library is running in demo mode otherwise, false.

      • getIsConnected

        public boolean getIsConnected()
        Returns if the library has an active Bluetooth connection.
        Returns:
        True if there is an active connection with a V1Connection otherwise, false.

        This method will set up a callback to use when we determine that the running device may not support SPP.
        Parameters:
        _obj - The object that will receive the unsupported callback.
        _function - The function to be called,

      • setDemoConfigurationCallbackData

        public void setDemoConfigurationCallbackData(java.lang.Object _owner,
                                    java.lang.String _function)
        Sets the callback data for when the demo data processing finds a User Settings packet in it. Requires a function with a UserSettings parameter: public void function( UserSettings _parameter)
        Parameters:
        _owner - Object to be notified when there is a demo data user settings object in the demo data
        _function - Function to be called

      • startUpSync

        public boolean startUpSync(BluetoothDevice deviceToConnect)
        Deprecated. DO NOT USE. THIS METHOD WILL BE REMOVED IN THE NEXT API RELEASE.
        Synchronously connects with deviceToConnect. This method is synchronous and WILL NOT return until a connection has failed or succeeded. (DO NOT CALL FROM UI THREAD)
        Parameters:
        deviceToConnect - A V1Connection you want to make a connection with.
        Returns:
        True if a connection was made otherwise returns false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if called from the UI (Main) Thread.

      • onConnectEvent

        public void onConnectEvent(boolean isConnected)
        A callback method that gets triggered when a connection event completes.
        Parameters:
        isConnected - true if the connection event results in a connection, false otherwise.

      • onDisconnected

        public void onDisconnected()
        A callback method that gets triggered when a disconnection event completes.

      • onConnectionLoss

        public void onConnectionLoss()
        A callback method that gets triggered when a connection loss occurs.

      • startUpAsync

        public int startUpAsync(BluetoothDevice deviceToConnect,
               ConnectionType connectionType)
        Asynchronously connects to deviceToConnect using the specified connectionType. This method is asynchronous and will return the result of the connection attempt to the calling objects callback method. (Safe to call from the UI thread)
        Parameters:
        deviceToConnect - A V1Connection you want to make a connection to.
        connectionType - The ConnectionType to use when connecting with the V1Connection. Valid values are: ConnectionType.V1Connection, ConnectionType.V1Connection_LE
        Returns:
        True if a connection process has been initiated, false otherwise.

      • setProtectLegacyMode

        public void setProtectLegacyMode(boolean val)
        Set method to determine if the ESP library should protect legacy mode. If this value is true when the V1 is running in Legacy mode, the write thread will not send any commands that are not compatible with Legacy Mode. The only commands that are compatible with Legacy Mode is a V1 mute request and a version request to the V1connection. If this value is false, the write thread will send all commands to all devices. This value is defaulted to false to make it compatible with older versions of this library.
        Parameters:
        val - The new value of this setting.

      • getProtectLegacyMode

        public boolean getProtectLegacyMode()
        Get the current state of Legacy Mode protection provided by the ESP library. Refer to setProtectLegacyMode for more information on this feature.
        Returns:
        The current state of Legacy Mode protection provided by the ESP library.

      • registerForDisconnectEvent

        public boolean registerForDisconnectEvent(java.lang.String callbackMethod,
                                 java.lang.Object callbackOwner)
        Registers an object with this class to receive a disconnection event.
        Parameters:
        callbackMethod - The method name inside of the object that would like to receive a disconnection event. The method name is case sensitive.
        callbackOwner - The object to which the method belongs.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback was successfully registered. Returns false if the callbackOwner/callbackMethod is null or if the callbackMethod is empty.

      • registerForConnectEvent

        public boolean registerForConnectEvent(java.lang.String callbackMethod,
                              java.lang.Object callbackOwner)
        Registers an object with this class to receive a connection event.
        Parameters:
        callbackMethod - The method name inside of the object that would like to receive a disconnection event. The method must accept a boolean flag that indicates if the connection event resulted in a connection. The method name is case sensitive.
        callbackOwner - The object to which the method belongs.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback was successfully registered. Returns false if the callbackOwner/callbackMethod is null or if the callbackMethod is empty.

      • registerForStopNotification

        public void registerForStopNotification(java.lang.Object _stopObject,
                               java.lang.String _stopFunction)
        This registers an object/function combination to be notified when the ESP client stops. Only one allowed at a time Requires a function with a Void parameter: public void function( Void _parameter)
        Parameters:
        _stopObject - Object with the function to be called
        _stopFunction - Function to be called

      • deregisterForStopNotification

        public void deregisterForStopNotification()
        This removes all registrations for callbacks to be notified when the ESP client stops.
        Parameters:
        _stopObject - Object with the function to be called
        _stopFunction - Function to be called

      • registerForPacket

        public void registerForPacket(PacketId _type,
                     java.lang.Object _callBackObject,
                     java.lang.String _method)
        This registers an object/function combination to be notified when a specific ESP packet is received. Requires a function with a Void parameter: public void function( ESPPacket _parameter)
        Parameters:
        _type - - The packet id the registration is for.
        _callBackObject - - The object to use for the callback.
        _method - - The method in _callbackObject to call.

      • deregisterForPacket

        public void deregisterForPacket(PacketId _type,
                       java.lang.Object _object,
                       java.lang.String _method)
        This method will deregister callback set up using registerForPacket. All callbacks for the PacketId and object passed in will be deregistered.
        Parameters:
        _type - The packet id to deregister.
        _object - The object to deregister.
        _method - The callback method.

      • deregisterForPacket

        public void deregisterForPacket(PacketId _type,
                       java.lang.Object _object)
        This method will deregister callback set up using registerForPacket. Only the callback that matches the object and method passed in will be deregistered.
        Parameters:
        _type - - The packet id to deregister.
        _object - - The object to deregister.
        _method - - The name of the callback method.

      • isRegisteredForPacket

        public boolean isRegisteredForPacket(PacketId _type,
                            java.lang.Object _object)
        This method will allow the caller to determine if they have already registered for a specific packet using registerForPacket.
        Parameters:
        _type - - The PacketId to search for.
        _object - - The object to search for.
        Returns:
        - true if the obect is already registered for the packet id passed in, else false.

      • stopSync

        public void stopSync()
        Deprecated. DO NOT USE. THIS METHOD WILL BE REMOVED IN THE NEXT API RELEASE.
        Synchronously disconnects from the V1Connection if connected and shuts down the ESP Library. (DO NOT CALL FROM UI THREAD)
        Parameters:
        deviceToConnect - A V1Connection you want to make a connection with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if called from the UI (Main) Thread.

      • stopAsync

        public void stopAsync()
        Asynchronously disconnect from the V1Connection and shuts down the ESP Library. (Safe to call from the UI thread)

        Parameters:

      • startDemo

        public void startDemo(java.lang.String _demoData,
             boolean _repeat)
        Starts the ESP Library demo mode. This will disconnect the client from a connected V1Connection.
        Parameters:
        _demoData - String containing demo mode data.
        _repeat - Indicates if the the demo mode data should loop indefinitely.

      • stopDemo

        public boolean stopDemo(boolean _restartLiveMode)
        Stop demo mode and optionally establish a new bluetooth connection.
        Parameters:
        _restartLiveMode - If true, an attempt will be made to connect to the last used V1Connection.
        Returns:
        Always returns true, unless unable to connect with a V1Connection.

      • clearAllCallbacks

        public void clearAllCallbacks()
        This method will remove all callbacks set up using registerForCallbacks.

      • clearCallbacks

        This method will clear all callbacks set up using registerForCallbacks for the packet id passed in
        Parameters:
        _type - - The packet id to deregister.

      • registerForNoDataNotification

        public void registerForNoDataNotification(java.lang.Object _noDataObject,
                                 java.lang.String _noDataFunction)
        Register a function to be notified if the ESP client has not received any data from the Valentine One after X seconds. Example case of this being called, the valentine one has been turned off for more than X seconds. Requires a function with a String parameter: public void function( String _parameter) Only one Notification callback is allowed at a time, registering a second will overwrite the first
        Parameters:
        _noDataObject - The object with the function to be notified when there is no data from the Valentine One.
        _noDataFunction - The callback function to receive the no data event.

      • deregisterForNoDataNotification

        public void deregisterForNoDataNotification()
        Deregister callbacks set up using registerForNoDataNotification.

      • notifyNoData

        public void notifyNoData()
        Performs the registerForNoDataNotification callback.

      • getDemoData

        public DemoData getDemoData()
        Return the last demo mode data file contents loaded in.
        Returns:
        The last demo mode data file contents loaded in.

      • doUnsupportedDeviceCallback

        public void doUnsupportedDeviceCallback()
        Notifies who ever is registered to receiver the Unsupported Device callback.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        This method will allow the caller to determine if this object is currently set up to process ESP data.
        Returns:
        Returns true if Processing Thread is alive otherwise, false.

      • getSocket

        @Deprecated
public BluetoothSocket getSocket()
        Deprecated. DO NOT USE. THIS METHOD WILL BE REMOVED IN THE NEXT API RELEASE.
        This method returns the BluetoothSocket of the current Bluetooth connection (IF SUPPORTED).
        Returns:
        Returns BluetoothSocket of the current Bluetooth connection, if available, otherwise, null. (Bluetooth LE connections do not using BluetoothSockets so null will always be returned)

      • getConnectedBTDeviceName

        public java.lang.String getConnectedBTDeviceName()
        Returns a human friendly name for the connected V1Connection.
        Returns:
        If there is a connection with a V1Connection returns a human friendly name for the device otherwise, an empty string.
